instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.TPS51980: What is TPS51980? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1286 Macbook Pros,  A1297 Macbook Pros,  A1369 Macbook Airs,  A1466 Macbook Airs,  A1370 Macbook Airs,  and A1465 Macbook Airs.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but no power
threads.message:
The mac had a liquid spill (keyboard was sticky), the previous owner cleaned the board and it was working fine.

when I got the MacBook, the board was clean and it was working just fine, I
reinstalled the os and when a customer came to buy it, it just died!


I disconnected the battery and plugged it back in and once again it started working fine, 10 mins later it went dead again...


Green light comes on and turns to orange after 3 seconds.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is 16.5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is 12v (should be 5v?)

Missing rails:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_34</SIGNAL>

There seems to be a short to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, measured on <CAPACITOR>C7592</CAPACITOR>, I compared it with a working board.

The board looks clean with no burned components so I'm really confused.

Apologies if I have missed anything, I'm still learning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but no power
threads.message: Exact voltage on PPBUS? Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>? If you have 12 volts on <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> something is wrong there check around <CHIP>TPS51980</CHIP> for damage or knocked off components

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light but no power
threads.message: plugged it back in and it started smoking. I'm done with this board, thanks anyway John
